values:
lost in thought
the silence
of dark shadow
embraces me 
comforts me
and gives fuel
to the fire
that is my muse
words silhouetted
by cast light
are easier to recognize
than those living
within the
phosphorescent glare
in darkness
i can find the honesty
to write of
dreams of light
while never
having to chance
a visit there myself
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/43017.html

as i sojourned
through the mists
of chaos
i came upon
a stillness
of heart and mind
i had long forgot
could exist
drifting upon
these calm waters
a voice spoke to me
but in a whisper
welcome home
old friend
it has been too long
do i know you
i asked softly
as well well as 
you know yourself
it answered
it was only then
that i recognized
my own voice
and realized my journey
was coming to an end
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/42840.html

beauty
needs no color
no magic
no words
to enhance
its subtle imagery

beauty
is not seen
with eyes
but is felt
within our
heart and soul

beauty
should move us
enlighten us
inspire us
to look past
the facade

beauty
just needs the courage
to step out of
the shadows
and into the light
to be noticed
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/42568.html

out of focus
just a blur within
the stark outlined images
of reality mundane
the beauty of the unknown
an ethereal dream
seeming to come to life
undefined
an untainted wisp
of imagination found
within this
unimaginative world
a splash of color
standing outward
from another gray day
the who and why
matters not
for what matters
is that the gift
has been noticed
and will be remembered
cherished
by unfeigned means
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/42380.html

to say that my mother and i had an acrimonious relationship would be to engage in reckless understatement. she was my nemesis, my oppressor, my abuser, and also, what gave me life. a dickensian mix, to be sure.

in late december of 1999 she began what would be her final illness, from a flu virus that in all likelihood i gave her. i found out after she died that she was less than six months from the same fate due to several different maladies, but it was my flu that finally got her. 

she always said that i would be the death of her, i'm pleased, for her sake, she was correct. she did love to be right at my expense.

easter always makes me think of her because for some reason she loved it so much. i know not why, as we were not particularly religious. one of those life's mysteries, i suppose.

it was 5 january when they called.

'she's not responding, we think it's close.'

i went down to the hospital and sat with her, really the only person left in the world that would do so, and even i didn't know why i was there. she had burned bridges with every other human being close to her, me included, but i felt a sense of duty. she brought me into this world, i would see her out of it.

she had been unconscious since 28 december, our last conversation, which was meaningless, having taken place the day before that. there wouldn't really be anything to say anyway. no apology could make up for what she'd done to me, no acceptance of such would be believed. so it was probably best we were in this state anyway. she held on through the night and left to the next life at 4:22 am on 6 january 2000. the sirens sounded, beeps stopped, people rushed in to help, but it was for naught, we all knew what the eventual outcome would be.

as this was happening i turned to the window and looked outside to the fog. in the reflection i could see all that was going on, but didn't care. a line from a song kept running through my head...

"it's over now. i'm cold. alone. i'm just a person on my own. nothing means a thing to me. nothing, means a thing to me."

i walked from the hospital. it was a cold, misty night with clouds at ground level. the salt-ridden pacific air filled my lungs. i drove around for a while, eventually arriving at the beach, which was about 12 blocks from the hospital, and parked the car. walking through the sand in the gathering dawn i took place on the highest dune i could find. 

i sat there for a long time. the sun was beginning to rise, casting the world into a grey light from the constant clouds that plague that little island. 

she was gone.

i was free.

i miss her, sometimes, more for what she could have represented to me than what she actually was. as i write this, her earthly remains are above me on a bookcase in my living room, in an odd way, watching over me. i don't know what to do with them, so there they sit, year after year. perhaps that is the greatest victory of all.

in my belief system she's about 8 years old now in a new life. i hope she learned from the last one. 

i know i did.
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/42060.html

within reach
yet i find myself
left wanting
serenity
peace of mind
and will
i cannot find
torrents of thought
restless nights
my inner-self fights
with my outer facade
which is me
duality
always feeling split
from the whole
inconsistent
incomplete
envious
of the still waters
i once was
simplicity
has become mania
striving to regain
what i have lost
to once again
breathe in
the sweet cool air
of a soul
at peace within
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/41766.html

ink
pushing pen
upon paper
words stream forth
like blood
from an open wound
an endless flow
diction
conviction
emotion
all pulled at
by the undercurrents
of metaphoric tides
and headstrong muses
there have been those
who would try
to stem the course
but it is
nothing but folly
and the dam
inevitably bursts
the river
of my words
will always overflow
the banks
of constrictive times
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/41333.html

i stand 
facing the new day
with the rising 
of the sun
possibilities 
begin to bud
upon the trees 
of this wilderness 
called life
hopes and dreams
are given their chance
to bloom 
into reality
if their will 
is strong enough
the past 
can be forgotten
and the future 
can be given
an encouraging glance
however
all this depends
upon the present
and how you face 
the dawn
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/41204.html

a shadow play
the light of desire
casts its silhouette
against the veil of need
a dark dance
illuminated
by flames of passion
instinct plays a rhythm
of animalistic wanting
by which she moves
graceful
lustful
in tune with the 
chemistry of the erotic
attraction and enticement
are her true means
and fulfillment is the ends
to which she justifies all
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/40714.html

a silhouette whispers
into the light
i am darkness craving
the lucent glow
of love transcendent
i am the ever night
longing for the
iridescent sunrise
of a brand new day
i am nothingness
wanting to be lead
by my timid hand
into a world where my
heart and soul
can live burden free
and my eyes
can finally see
what i have dreamed of
for an eternity
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/40649.html

ever waiting
for fate to by chance
come my way
in the middle of the
empty nowhere
i hope to stand out
to be noticed
for i feel at times
i am invisible
everywhere else i tread
maybe i can lure
the fickle one here
like a single tree
attracts lightning
in an open field
and in a flash
my only wish
will come knocking
on my proverbial door
it may be a fools hope
but it is all
i have left
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/40394.html

the
flame of thought
eternal
a mental reflection
of ideals
burning within
radical
metaphorical
simplistic
all yearning
to get their due
physical
visual
fuel for the
imaginative fire
for within
the human mind
is the ability
to ignite a spark

a gift
that should never
be taken
lightly

moves through mind
like clouds through sky
covering a thought
as if obscuring
an eclipse of the moon
because it isn't realized
doesn't mean it's not there
take time to watch the clouds
you never know

her eyes

and dance with desire
yet she carries

to need
she is the soul
of the stars

of the night
her heart

if only

finding love
like picking

that catches

hanging from a

i pull myself

for fear if
i let myself go
let myself be free
to float in the clouds
like my heart does
the inevitable fall
will shatter more
than my fragile spirit
and there will be
too many pieces of me
to ever be
put right again
love may be
the glue that binds
but i doubt there
will ever be
enough to repair

within my soul
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/39109.html

who am i
waiting for
day after day
i stare out
a metaphorical
window
forever watching
wondering
what i have 
to do
am i missing 
something
am i 
not worthy
of that look
or are they
afraid to love
with their hearts
and not
their eyes
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/38788.html

with a leap of faith
my spirit takes flight
i soar through the clouds
into the unknown
searching for the seemingly
simple prize
to be at peace
within the world i live
it is a journey
of balance
the yin and yang
of want and need
and the price to be paid
for the elusive gift i seek
as long as i keep
the essence
of who i truly am
the ends will
justify the means
and that is all
i can ever ask
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/38557.html

the rebirth
of every day
the newness
still wet
with the
heavy dew
of morning
a clean start
to the life
that had left us
weighted down
with the dust
of the dreams
of yesterday
yet with each
sunrise comes
the chance
the possibility
of a better
brighter day
of hope
springing eternal
and of things
being set right
this is the gift
of tomorrows
and why we look
to them
longingly from today

from upon high

my world
and find it
at times
lacking
myself wanting
surrounded by beauty
yet i cannot

feel it

all i can envision

the picturesque view
the gritty blur
of a world
moving too fast

all i wish for
is the time

bathing her

poetry 
surrounds us all

see it
feel it

and breathe life in
to open their minds
let their thoughts 
take flight
and let their imagination
soar
amongst the clouds
poetry is not words
it is the emotion
and vision of life
through a 
personal perspective
the eyes and heart
write the poetry
the words are just a took
to express that vision

raindrops fall

saturated lashes

of pasts and
things to come
there are no stars

all light

you

hollow dream

emptiness

wondering

a lifetime of

who are you

not here
your being
only a dream
is my biggest fear
i've loved you
and held you
for nights 
on end

dies again

with you

lightly
the warmth
flesh to flesh
a sigh
a shiver
a heartbeat felt

of a face
lost to desire
a longing
a craving

flawless in presence

not to follow her

the picked flower

unable to truly grow

wander free
it will eventually

in loneliness
will its beauty leave

will its scent be

or will it just

like the memory
of why it was
torn from its happy life
in the first place

of the lonely

cannot ever hope
to cleave in twain
it takes the

of two hearts
to disperse
the lingering shadows
and allow them
to walk free
in the light 
of love
that is their due

self voyeurism

emotional distance
who am i
what am i
why am i
the self-questioning
is endless
and the answers
never seem to come
i am seen differently

personal path
that i cross
and yet those views
never seem to match
my own
i am left wondering
is this just part

or am i simply

the past
the present
the future
all weigh me down
leaving me
unable to reach
the lighted surface
i gasp for air
but instead
i choke
on fluid memories
crushed
by self imposed
pressure
i fear falling
into the depths
of bitter cold
despair

and be made

repeadedly
all i can hope
is that this time

missteps and pitfalls
and finally exit
into the light

another

and its muted light
gets swallowed
by the coming dusk
as i sit in the

i feel the tides
pull upon my being
the ebb and flow
of the crashing surf
that is my life
matches the rhythm
of my thoughts
the push and pull
of emotions
left unrequited
the rise and fall
of questions
left unanswered
and i find myself
wishing the night
would come swiftly
so i can again
be at peace
in the comfort

the darkness

delicate

as i lean in
the warmth

burning mine

with anticipation
of this act
best not done
but inevitable
in closer
beyond the point
of no return
we touch
in a way
not innocent
for the first time

with anticipation

awaken

my life 
a reflection
an introspection
i evaluate
the mettle
of this
weary soul
things that were

things that are

a forge forming
possibilities

with a renewal
of my heart
comes softer

As I grow older, I think, well at least I hope, I grow wiser. The adage that you learn something new every day is trite, but still very true.

I am an avid animal lover, as those of you who know me well, which in this venue I would like to think is most of you, know. I have four cats under my care currently. Yes, I said "under my care". What does that mean, I hear you ask. Why did you say that? Why did you put it that way?

I don't own these animals. I can't own them, they are not property. They are living, sentient beings in my care. I feed them, give them shelter and love them. In return, they give me love (some more so than others, but that's just how cats are) and make me happy. Not one day goes by that I don't look at one of them and smile, or feel a little ping of love in my chest when I pet them. They bring me immense joy. I am enriched by their presence both in my house and in my life. Not a week goes by that I don't say to one of them "I am so glad to know you", (and no, they don't answer). 

So, it has always puzzled me, when I go to the vet, or have some other interaction that involves them somehow, when people say "are you their owner?". No. Of course not. How can I own them? The idea seems ludicrous and backwards to me, akin to my owning a person.

This philosophy has now been expanded for me thanks to a book I read yesterday called Ishmael given to me by a friend who was touched by it as well.

What right do I have to the earth? Do I own this land my house sits on? Do I own the orange tree that is towering over me as I write this? Do I own the birds in that tree? What cosmic right has been given to me, just another mammal, to take ownership over these things?

I no more own the land this structure (that will be gone in 100 years at most) sits on than I could own the air that surrounds it, or the tree growing by it, or...my cats.

It seems so obvious to me now, but yesterday, I hadn't ever considered it. I am not the end of my species' evolutionary path. The earth was not created for the use (and plundering) of homo sapiens sapiens any more than it was created for the rock doves chiriping on my porch or my little girl kitten chirping back at them.

This is dangerously close to a "spaceship earth" kind of tirade, I realize. However, now I feel that perhaps that argument is closer to the truth than not.

We are at a pivotal time in both our history as a civilization and as a species. This place, this planet, was not created for us by some magical sky wizard in 144 hours about 5,800 years ago for our use. We are not the pinnacle of evolution who can do what we want with this place. We are not here to be the conclusion of growth on this world, but we may end up causing it.

Just as it is my responsibility to feed, care for and be a guardian to the animals in my care, it is our responsibility to feed, care for and be guardians to this world that we call home.

That is what I learned today.
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/31373.html

on the edge
of the great well
of her future
her little legs
dangle as she
looks at the stars
floating above her
as if suspended
in a cosmic mobile
all that she is
all that she shall be
lies before her
in the sky
just past her reach
small hands
resting on the cold stone
of the well
a light breeze
moves through
her hair of
raven black
what will i be
who will i love
all questions in
her growing mind
the universe is there
watching her
and responds
que sera sera
dearest little marie
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/31146.html

a view of love
seen by eyes
in awe of
the moment
with a look
that i had only
seen in dreams
it has left
me frozen
afraid to move
and if it
is only a dream
i wish never
to waken
for fear of
losing
this moment
and this view
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/30724.html

the wind 
of change
blows strong
i must adapt
or be 
swept away
into nothingness
i will bend
but i will
not break
it is a battle
of survival
of wills
and i shall
win
http://cyanmancer.livejournal.com/30673.html

ding
time has come
ding
we look back
ding
wonder forward
ding
imagining things different
ding
dreaming things new
ding
forecasting the future
ding
reveling in the past
ding
